content.title: Pediatric Iatrogenic Vascular Injury
content.definition: Management of vascular injuries occurring as complications of medical procedures in pediatric patients, most commonly from cardiac catheterization, ECMO cannulation, and central venous access.

key_concepts.description: Cardiac catheterization (most common), ECMO cannulation, central line placement, umbilical vessel catheterization, orthopedic procedures.
Femoral artery (cardiac cath), internal jugular/subclavian veins (central lines), umbilical vessels (neonates), brachial artery (blood draws).
Smaller vessels more prone to thrombosis and spasm. Observation period often appropriate. Growth implications of repair.

presentation.acute: Pulse loss, cool extremity, delayed capillary refill

initial_management.observation: Often first line - many resolve with heparinization
initial_management.surgery: If limb threatened or failed conservative management

management.observation: With close monitoring if collaterals maintain perfusion

central_venous_injury.consequences: Loss of future access sites, SVC syndrome, pulmonary embolism

umbilical_vessel_injury.complications: Thrombosis extending to aorta or portal vein

surgical_principles.timing: Observe initially if not immediately limb-threatening
surgical_principles.repair: Primary repair preferred, autologous vein for bypass

outcomes.long_term: Surveillance for stenosis, limb length, aneurysm
outcomes.growth: May develop leg length discrepancy with significant injury

content.statement: Pediatric Iatrogenic Vascular Injury is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pediatric-Vascular that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Pediatric Iatrogenic Vascular Injury helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Pediatric Iatrogenic Vascular Injury include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Pediatric Iatrogenic Vascular Injury.

learning_objectives: List common causes of iatrogenic vascular injury in children
Describe initial management including observation period
Explain surgical options respecting vessel growth potential
clinical_pearls: Children have more vasospasm and collaterals - observation often works
Pulse loss after cardiac cath often resolves with heparinization
Avoid synthetic grafts that won't grow
Long-term surveillance for leg length discrepancy
